newsitem.title: UK: Tie Rack sets up JV with Japan's Fujita & Co.
newsitem.headline: Tie Rack sets up JV with Japan's Fujita & Co.

text.p: Tie Rack Plc said on Thursday it had set up a 50-50 joint venture with Fujita & Co Ltd of Japan as part of an expansion of its Asia Pacific operation.

"Our successful international expansion continues and we are delighted to announce the establishment of the joint venture in Japan with an excellent partner who has very strong operational and real estate expertise," said chairman Roy Bishko in a statement accompanying its results.

He said operations with Fujita -- which owns 50 percent of McDonalds Japan and through this 20 percent of Toys R Us Japan -- started on a license basis in July 1995 and there were 11 shops by the time the joint venture was established in February this year.
Earlier, the group reported an 11 percent increase in pretax profits to 8.79 million stg in the 53 weeks to February 2, on sales of 105.1 million stg, up nine percent.
